benchmark_details.name: VLT-MI (Visual Language Tracking with Multi-modal Interaction)
benchmark_details.overview: VLT-MI introduces multi-round interaction into the Visual Language Tracking task for the first time. It generates diverse, multi-granularity texts for interaction and proposes a new interaction paradigm for improved tracking performance.
benchmark_details.data_type: multi-modal interaction data with bounding boxes and textual descriptions

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a robust framework for evaluating and enhancing the capabilities of Visual Language Tracking systems through multi-round, multi-modal interactions.

data.source: Generated based on existing VLT benchmarks and DTLLM-VLT.
data.size: 3,619 videos with a total of 6.60M frames
data.annotation: Automatically generated textual descriptions based on video content.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on tracking performance across different datasets, considering the number of interactions and tracking successes.
methodology.interpretation: Higher metrics indicate better tracking performance and robustness of the tracker.
methodology.validation: Performance validated through comparative analysis with existing benchmarks.
